etymologies: 1930s: from modern Latin Mollienisia (former genus name), from the name of Count Mollien (1758–1850), French statesman

definitions: a small, livebearing freshwater fish that is popular in aquariums and has been bred in many colors, especially black.

notes.text: Genus Poecilia, family Poeciliidae: several species, in particular P. sphenops. See also sailfin molly

shortDefinitions: small live-bearing killifish which is popular in aquaria and has been bred in many colours
